message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! It's a high-quality item that I think you'll really love. I'm willing to let it go for $150.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $120. I'm trying to stay within a budget, and that's as high as I can go.

I understand that you're on a tight budget, Bob, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I can do $140, and that's as low as I can go. The product is worth a lot more to me than that, but I'm willing to make a compromise.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above that price. I can do $130, and that's my final offer. I really think that's a fair price for the product.

I understand that you're trying to get the best deal, Bob, but I'm not willing to go below $140. I can see you're willing to pay $130, so I'll meet you in the middle at $135. That's the lowest I can go.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me in the middle, but I'm still a bit above that price. I can do $132, and that's as low as I'm willing to go. I'm starting to think that's the best price I'll get, so I'm hoping you'll accept it.

I appreciate your willingness to make another slight adjustment, but I'm still a bit above that price. I'm getting close to my limit, and I'm starting to think that I should just go to John's offer. However, I'll make one last attempt to negotiate. I can do $136, and that's as low as I'm willing to go. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider buying from John.
